name: You Have 10 Seconds
description: You Have 10 Seconds is a fast paced arcade style platformer game with over 40 levels.
minimum_requirements: OS: Windows XP, Windows 7, Windows 8 Memory: 1 GB RAM Graphics: 128MB Storage: 40 MB available space

reviews.review_text: You could theoretically beat this game in 400 seconds.
It's free, it has tight controlls, it's short, it's fun, not too rage inducing, and there is a sequel coming out on steam Greenlight.  It's so beautiful, it brings a tear to my eye. :,)
Fun but frustrating. Recomming highly
This is a lovely little game to test your level of frustration...

*sigh* unzip ... wait wrong review , nvm 10secs have passed. Tl;Dr - 10secs in a level . 40 levels divided by 4 arenas , if you die , you have to restart from level 1 of that arena. Game is fun and yet frustrating because of only 10secs.
beat it in 11 minutes fun game
Why only 10 seconds? because its rage-inducing stupid fun that will make you laugh and cry at the same time while kicking you in the balls.   Dont do it; its a trap.  10/10 would play again though.
I liked the sound effects and graphics of this game and i would highly recommend it
beat it in 11 minutes fun game

You know a Game is 'LIT AF' when it gives you 10 seconds but you don't last that long.  #KillerMemeStar  View my 2 Part Gameplay!  PART 1 ►         YouTube™ Video:  I DON'T HAVE MUCH TIME TO LIVE? (You Have 10 Seconds - PART 1)

I wish I had ten spacebars.  This is a short, straightforward, free-to-play platformer where you play a cute little 'box' trying to run and jump through 40 levels that are often tiny but sometimes challenging, divided into four areas of ten levels each. Finish an area, and you get an item you'll need in order to complete the next. Item gains are retroactive, so you can return to most earlier areas with your newfound abilities despite there not being a need to do so. Run out of your stock of lives by hitting floor spikes or letting the eponymous time limit expire, and you'll be sent back to the main menu to do the whole area all over again.  The game is kind enough to give a flashing-light warning to epilepsy-sensitive players, which is important since most of the game's 'gimmick' is in its hyperactive backgrounds. These are meant to be distracting and to psyche you out as you quickly figure out how to move through a level. Levels also have aesthetic 'dressing' on them, so you have to try through experimentation to see what objects impact the gameplay and which are simply part of the art. The music is really, really good, and it's somewhat hard to complain about frustration when even repeating several levels in a row can take less than 15 seconds to get back to where you got stuck. The sections where you have to train yourself *not* to jump excessively prove the most memorable.  Most of the game isn't very difficult, save for a few levels in Area 3 (Area 4, despite its additional trick, is easier), and you don't have collectibles to bother with other than 1-Ups you can find in certain places. The last level contains a big surprise and is a ton of fun.  You could probably complete a good chunk of the game in the time it took me to type this review, but for $0 and a tiny download, there's no reason not to give it a try.

Fun-Rage Enducing-Fun With Friends...   This game was so fun to play me and 2 of my friends had a competition and i won first and we just a had a good time playing this and i hope it become more then just a green light game.
This game is so cool!

This game is a great game, a good way to kill some time, and also if your bad at games that need jumping (with weired controlls) it's a good way to release your anger out when you die to much XD   But seriously though., this game is really good and I don't think I've came acrossed a platformer that gives you a 10second time-limit  P.S Markiplier sent me to this game :3   my gameplay          YouTube™ Video:  |Platformer Game| You Have 10 Seconds | Part 1
this game is VERY HARD :p i like it
you have 10 seconds

You have 10 seconds is an easy to get into platformer, which, like the title implies, gives you ten seconds to complete each level. The keys are simplistic but aren't as precise as say Super meat boy. In some levels I also felt that skill didn't really matter and you could just spam space bar and boom. The soundtrack is OK but it doesn't have much standouts. I did thouroughly enjoy the last level. For a 28 mb download I'd say this game is worth a shot to have some good fun. I did end up beating the game in about half an hour, but one of the achievements is to beat the game in five minutes, so it's a relatively short game. It's a fun, short, platformer, and I'd say it's worth a good hour of your time. I'd give it an average 5/10. Hopefully in the future they add more levels. I would gladly play more of this game. Enjoy. Also the trailer dropped for the second game and it looks like it has more variety and levels. And it's free, of course.
Quick, simple, highly fun. A good quick speedrun, if that's your thing.

Simple, fun, addicting, and has one of the best designed difficulty curves ever in a game. Short and sweet, the best way to describe it is a mix between You Have to Win the Game and Geometry Dash. It is extremely short (I've already beat it twice in under an hour of play time), but it is free, so you have nothing to lose.
This is a great rage game that would be fun to do a lets play on!

one of those little hidden gems in the steam store library. Very small game and you can easily lose yourself for a few minutes. Reminded me of games I used to play when I was small on the TV.  Definitely recommended and no harm in trying out

Fun fast little jump game that gives you a limited amount of lives and not a whole lot of time to complete a level.  It's free so I say give it a play just to get the experience. Personally can't get past stage two but it was fun for the 5mins I put in.

I like it,but the mechanics are annoying. After Area 3 you have double jump and the ability to swim. And in my case,on stage 3-10,i hit the roof and i cannot jump. I get it is hard but not impossible! *Edit*It is not impossible,but spamming my space bar is not the funnest way to play a platoformer.

A really fun free game! It's perfect if you're just looking for something that you can just play through in half a hour. My one complaint is that the whole premise of only having 10 seconds per level never really matters. You complete all of the levels without even having to worry about the timer. I still recomend trying it though!

This game was awesome, Haha I had fun xD raged a lot but shoot was so much fun! here's a gameplay if anyone wants to see a review!         YouTube™ Video:  [Rage] WORSE THAN GRAVITY CAT!? [You Have 10 Seconds]
I love it please add more stages!
Nice game simple graphics but.. *hard*

I would not recommend this game if it costed anything, but as a free to play game it's a fun little time waster. The only complaint I have about the game is that the controls are dreadful and unresponsive.

Last level gives you 40 seconds  0/10 was lied to  Seriously though, a nice little game for when you have 15 spare minutes. Has a no deaths achivement for those who like to punish themselves. Why not pick it up?
25MB Game that is so cool challenging  download this game and i dare you to finish all the levels
Such a simple and clean ish game to pass the time, would reccomend to anyone.

Very short and sweet game. Beat it in 15 minutes  (Had to make that review in 10 seconds. There are three achivments. One is for beating the game, one is for beating the game a 2nd time but without dying, and the last one is for beating the game in five minutes. Only got the first one so far.)
Went with my morning just as well as those 5 doughnuts I ate for breakfast  10/10 beats Geometry Dash

This is a 2-D platformer. You controll a Square with eyes. You can jump, move left and right, and even get new skills. There are 4 levels with 10 challanges in them each. You need to do the 10 in a row to clear that level and you only have 10 seconds on each so hurry. Do not worry cause you will begin with 2 extra lifes and there are about 2 extra once you can pick up. This game has some great music, simplistic but good gameplay, no violance apart from dying on spikes, but it only goes to white and spits you out on the start again. This game will test your skills to some extence. In the game there are some achievement goal you can try to go after that will not count on steam. Speedrun, Ironman, finding a secret and beating the game. So if this sounds like something for you then try out this free game.  Have fun, enjoy and hurry :)
i think this game was awesome and was rage inducing but still it was fun and adictive

Overall a pretty good -- though very short -- game. My only complIaint is in the difficulty. I think this game is tagged as difficult but I did not feel that to be the case. There were some levels that I died a few times on, but there were so many levels that we giveaways. Because I had to do Area 4 many times to get past the ending level, it's freshest in my memory. In I think the 7th level, there's no use of the magnet item, and there's nothing to kill you or trick you or take much of your time. This is so close to the end of the game and yet it's a giveaway level, I would consider it a waste. The game would be just the same without that level except that I wouldn't be thinking everytime how much of a waste that level is. In general, the timer is extremely lenient, as I never once ran out of time or felt the pressure to rush through levels. In fact, most of the pressure to play quickly came from the fast falling physics, which were frustrating at times but looking back I think it was a good choice. In summary, making the levels longer or the timer shorter, and make every level count. I think that's the difference between a pretty good game and a really fun game. It definitely helps kill a few minutes though.
Personally i am still trying to get the last achievement (deathless) and i have to say this is an amazingly fun game

>Game finishes downloading >Takes time to find out how to start game >40 mins later  >I am close to buring my computer with gasoline >I complete all 10 lvls of area 4 with 0 lifes left >COUNTDOWN STARTS >I am not looking not at my computer because of how proud I am >Then I return to my computer  >The timer is at 5 I start trying to rush the lvl  >Then I die >Then I die in game

All I have to say about this game is that it's hard. It is just unbelievably hard. I would go as far as to compare this game in level of difficulty to BattleBlock Theater. I also really enjoy the game. It feels more like a game that you can just boot up and start playing. Because some games feel like the are trying to impress you with the experience but this game feels more welcoming and simple to play. I almost wanted to punch through my screen after a while. The only complint I have is that their are no checkpoints in the game which makes it irratating to have to start all over again. but besides that it is a real good game 9/10 would be enfuriated again.
Great Game! Fun and Simple! I Love It!
Awesome game. Definitely for gamers wanting a quick experience. I definitely recommend playing the 2nd one.
Fun fast paced game
Pretty fun game. It downloaded in 2 seconds and I finished it in like 15 minutes so it's quite short, but if you are bored or have nothing to do it's really worth a try.
this game is okay but 'rage platformers' such as this one should not have limited lives
Interesting idea, Awesome music, but levels that are rage-worthy. I was expecting a fairly decent challenge, but not impossible levels, where I bang my head at a wall. 6/10
Good game easy to complete challenging only on last lvl completed in 16 mins cuz stage 4 i dank as ♥♥♥♥

A time-waster. A short and fun experience for a one time. Maybe even a few more times to get that last achievement. It's free, so give this short gem a try!      BTW, press any of the number keys on top of the keyboard to change your color, this unlocks the 'Artist' achievement.
You Have 10 Seconds is a fun, challenging 2D platforming game. It is very fun to speedrun, and to play casually. It is a very enjoyable game to play.
very fun with controller, but also, if even a bit skilled, very short
A great little game, especially for the price (free!) There's really no reason to not at least give this a shot. I enjoyed it.

Fun gameplay, silmple concept, cute artstile, and it's free!

Although I'm not the type of person who would rage at games like these. It's fun, difficult and very much possible to speedrun the game under 5 minutes. I would recommend this game to the people who have a lot of patience.
Little but fun. This is one of the best games you can get FOR FREE

Pros : Fun Gameplay Hard Levels Only 10 seconds for every level Indie game (Indie games is my favorite kind of games) Free To Play Pretty Graphics (For 2D indie game that probably took 10 seconds to create)  Cons : TOO DAMN SHORT! Only 4 Areas  Rating : 8/10
Short and Easy game but the only frustrating part is the bad controls.

For a game that describes itself as 'Levels are quick but hard to master', it sure isn't that difficult.  Its main trick isn't the difficulty of the course or mastering its secrets; rather, it's visual deception. The presentation is a bit obnoxious. with a some pattern that flashes in and out in the background while you play that's easily distracting, the player being hard to see among many of the backgrounds due to a poor lack of coloring and distinction, and courses can often be laid out in a way that deceives you into looking difficult, rather than actually being difficult. Once you get past the presentation and how the courses are laid out, it's way easier than it seems, and it becomes less about trial and error and learning the game's tricks and more about fighting against the visual design to look good. There's even a level in the fourth course called 'Confused?' which I think says it all. The final final area of course four is at least the least obnoxious-looking. A nice touch is that the lives counter stays static on a certain point of the level. If that's intentional, it's admittedly pretty funny.  There are also in-game achievements, but with the way this game is set up, why even bother going for those? As far as the soundtrack goes, it's pretty typical pump-up music, but not really anything more than decent. And thankfully the game doesn't belabor itself with dragging it on too long; I was able to more or less see everything and get the big picture in 20 minutes.  There's a sequel in the works, which I hope is frustrating but for the right reasons this time, rather than the wrong ones. I don't expect any of these side-scrolling, difficult 2D platformers to be on the same level as other highly-praised examples of the genre, but if the game has to rely on tricking you to give the illusion of difficulty, it's not really difficult so much as it is a burden.

This game is okay but it's not the best. It is like any other platforming game but with bad music and very bad visuals. If you are epiliptic you will not want to get this game under any circumstance because it will send you into a seziure in early stages up until the very short end of the game.
